humanum_full_description_en:
" Spoons " written in oracle bone inscriptions, bronze inscriptions, and Xiao Zhuan, which resemble food utensils for scooping food. The point in the middle of oracle bone inscriptions and bronze inscriptions means food. The original meaning is a utensil for scooping wine from a bottle, with a handle. "Said the text": "spoon, pour also take pictographic, there are real, and the package agreed.." " Scoop " and " bucket " shape similar to the difference between the two is at the " scoop " small " bucket big", " spoon "It is used to scoop wine, and the " bucket " is used to scoop food. "Zhou Li. Winter official test work record. "Jade Man": "Golden Spoon", Zheng Xuan's note quotes Du Zichun: "Spoon, that is, the spoon in the wine is also the spoon." That is, the " spoon " is used to scoop wine from wine bottles. "Rituals. "Xuan Jiu Li": "Two pots of Si ban, Zuo Xuan wine, add a spoon." "Si ban" is an ancient ritual vessel for placing wine bottles; "Xuan Jiu" is the water used as wine in ancient ceremonies; it means to put aside Two pots of wine are on Sri Lanka, the one on the left is Xuanjiu, and spoons are placed on both pots of wine. " Spoon " is also used as a unit of capacity. "Zhou Li. Winter official test work record. "Zi Ren": "Zi Ren is a drinking vessel, one liter of spoon." "Spoon one liter" means that one spoon is equivalent to one liter. Also used as a quantifier. Su Shi, "Xishan Poems and the Three and More Than Thirty People Again Use the Front Rhyme as Thank You": "I would like to ask Nanzong for a spoonful of water to mourn with Qu Jia." "Nanzong" is a school of Buddhism; " Nan " That is to clean; "Qu Jia" is Qu Yuan and Jia Yi; this sentence refers to the author's desire to get a spoonful of water from Buddhism and go to clean up the grievances for Qu Yuan and Jia Yi.

" Spoon " is also the name of ancient music and dance. "Rituals. "Yan Li": "If you dance, then "Spoon"." Zheng Xuan's note: ""Spoon", "Ode" chapter is completed the "Da Wu" music and song." "Book of Rites. "Nei Ze": "Ten have three years, learn "Yue", recite "Poem", dance "Spoon"." It means that a child is thirteen years old, learning "Le Scripture", recite "Book of Songs", learn "Spoon" dance.

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the name of the sacrifice, "Compilation" 35356: "Wang Qi has a spoon to Emperor Wenwu." " Spoon " is a sacrifice to ancestors. Also used as a place name, "He Ji" 27861: "Wang Wang Yushao." Also used as a name, "He Ji" 21041: "Hushao".

Bronze inscription is used as the name of the clan, spoon Ding: " Shao ".

" Spoon " is borrowed from Han silk books as " Zhao ", which is interpreted as the name of the country. "Mawangdui Silk Book. The 13th line of the Book of Political Strategists in the Warring States Period: "The evil of Qi Shao (Zhao) is getting worse for the ministers." It means that what the ministers worry about is that the two countries of Qi and Zhao are increasingly evil. Chinese silk manuscripts to " scoop " to " discretionary " construed wine. "Mawangdui Silk Book. The 28th line of "Health Prescriptions": "It is mash (should)", " mash " is a kind of wine. This sentence records the method of brewing mash. Han bamboo slips borrowed " spoon " as " shao ", "Wei Wuhan Acting Doctor. The second type of bamboo slips: "Rhubarb, Huang Cen, and Shao (Shao) Le (medicine) each have one or two." Han bamboo slips borrowed " Zhou " as " Spoon ", "Wei Wuhan Jane. Etiquette. "Yan Li": "If you dance, "Drink (Spoon)"." This edition of "Yi Li. "Yan Li" is "like a dance, "Spoon"".

The handed down documents use " spoon " as " disposal ", "Han Shu. "Li Yue Zhi": "Spoon pepper syrup, the spirit is drunk." Ancient Yan Shi's note: "Spoon, read and drink." "Jiao syrup" is a wine brewed with pepper to worship the gods, meaning that the gods drank it Pepper wine, all drunk.

The word " spoon " was later added with the meaning symbol " wood " to differentiate into the word "杓", which means that the utensils for scooping things are made of wood.

humanum_full_description:
甲骨文、金文、小篆寫作「勺」，象舀食物的食具之形。甲骨文、金文中間一點表示食物，本義是從樽中舀酒的用具，有柄。《說文》：「勺，挹取也。象形，中有實，與包同意。」「勺」與「斗」形狀相似，兩者的不同處在於「勺」小「斗」大，「勺」用作舀酒，「斗」用作舀取食物。《周禮．冬官考工記．玉人》：「黃金勺」，鄭玄注引杜子春：「勺，謂酒尊中勺也。」即「勺」用於酒樽中舀酒。《儀禮．鄉射禮》：「兩壺斯禁，左玄酒，皆加勺。」「斯禁」是古代放置酒樽的禮器；「玄酒」是古代祭禮中當酒用的清水；意謂放了兩壺酒在斯禁上，左邊的是玄酒，兩壺酒都放了勺子。「勺」又用作容量單位。《周禮．冬官考工記．梓人》：「梓人為飲器，勺一升。」「勺一升」就是一勺相當於一升。又用作量詞。蘇軾〈西山詩和三者三十餘人再用前韻為謝〉：「願求南宗一勺水，往與屈賈湔餘哀。」「南宗」是佛教的一個派別；「湔」即清洗；「屈賈」就是屈原和賈誼；這句指作者希望得到佛教的一勺水，前去為屈原和賈誼清洗哀怨。

　　「勺」又是古樂舞名。《儀禮．燕禮》：「若舞則《勺》。」鄭玄注：「《勺》，《頌》篇告成《大武》之樂歌也。」《禮記．內則》：「十有三年，學《樂》、誦《詩》、舞《勺》。」意謂小童十三歲，學習《樂經》、誦讀《詩經》、學習《勺》舞。

　　甲骨文用作祭名，《合集》35356：「王其有勺於文武帝。」「勺」是祭祀祖先的祭禮。又用作地名，《合集》27861：「王往于勺。」又用作人名，《合集》21041：「呼勺」。

　　金文用作氏族名，勺鼎：「勺」。

　　漢帛書借「勺」為「趙」，解作國名。《馬王堆帛書．戰國縱橫家書》第13行：「臣之所患，齊勺（趙）之惡日益。」意指臣所擔憂的，是齊趙兩國日益交惡。漢帛書以「勺」為「酌」，解作酒。《馬王堆帛書．養生方》第28行：「為醪勺（酌）」，「醪」是一種酒，此句記載釀造「醪酌」的方法。漢簡借「勺」為「芍」，《威武漢代醫簡．第二類簡》：「大黃、黃岑、勺（芍）樂（藥）各一兩。」漢簡借「酌」為「勺」，《威武漢簡．儀禮．燕禮》：「如舞則《酌（勺）》。」今本《儀禮．燕禮》作「如舞則《勺》」。

　　傳世文獻以「勺」為「酌」，《漢書．禮樂志》：「勺椒漿，靈已醉。」顏師古注：「勺，讀曰酌。」「椒漿」是以椒釀製、用以祭神的酒，意謂眾神喝了椒酒，都喝醉了。

　　「勺」字後來加上義符「木」，分化出「杓」字，表示舀東西的用具以木製成。
humanum_short_description: 「勺」象舀食物的食具之形，是「杓」的古字。

勺字的基本解释

勺
sháo
一种有柄的可以舀取东西的器具：勺子。饭勺儿。掌勺儿的（厨师）。
中国市制容量单位，一升的百分之一。

勺字的汉语字典释义

[①]［sháo］
［《廣韻》市若切，入藥，禪。］
(1)舀东西的用具，有柄。古代多用以从樽中舀酒。
(2)容量单位名。历代不同。
(3)今为市勺的简称，一市勺为百分之一市升。
(4)量词。一般物量名。
(5)形容少量、细微。
(6)同“芍”。参见“勺藥”。
(7)通“趙”。
[②]［zhuó］
［《廣韻》之若切，入藥，章。］
(1)古代乐舞名，相传为周公所作。
(2)古乐器。即籥。似笛而短小，可执之以舞。
(3)通“酌”。舀取。
(4)通“酌”。调和。《文选·宋玉〈招魂〉》：“瑶漿蜜勺，實羽觴些。”刘良注：“勺，和也。”一说勺为沾。《楚辞》王逸注：“勺，沾也……言食已，復有玉漿以蜜沾之。”参见“勺2藥”。
(5)通“酌”。取法。
(6)通“灼”。参见“勺2”。
